title: On the dimension of $s$-Nikod\'ym sets
authors: Damian D\k{a}browski, Max Goering, Tuomas Orponen
abstract:
Let $s \in [0,1]$. We show that a Borel set $N \subset \mathbb{R}^{2}$ whose
every point is linearly accessible by an $s$-dimensional family of lines has
Hausdorff dimension at most $2 - s$.
